website_summaries.verdict: While they're an affordable pair that's suitable for hikes, they aren't for climbing and may not hold up to extensive wear and tear.
pros: Stand out for their stretchy rubber strap system that makes them easy to put on most types of hiking boots
Lightweight and comfortable to wear on fairly rough terrain and ice
cons: Tends to fit tight on large-sized men's boots
A few durability concerns have been noted

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I used these on a backpacking trip to the Grand Canyon. The top of the rim was very icy for several miles and these literally saved my life. No joke. If i didn’t have these i would of been stuck at the bottom till the ice melted. Great price and great product. And easy to put on and take off.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Depper

customer_reviews.title: got the XL for size 9.5 shoes and very happy with it
customer_reviews.text: had the pleasure of hiking in the snow later in the season (April) by Flagstaff AZ. While I do wish I had snowshoes instead (at a few 5ft deep parts I sank into) these cleats kept me from sliding. They stayed on the shoes well, I had great traction on shallow unpacked and packed (groomed) snow and I think they'll work well for icy conditions as well. They were study enough that I felt comfortable leaving them on in patches without snow. I got the XL size which fit well on my 9.5 full size Oboz hiking boots
customer_reviews.author: patrician

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Used them recently when my driveway and parking area were covered with ice for several days. I can walk normal with great footing. I would advise using them on an extra pair of shoes because it takes a little effort to get them on but the flip side of that is they are not going to move around once they are on.
customer_reviews.author: Benaiah

customer_reviews.title: XXL on a pair of size 12 Salomon X Ultras
customer_reviews.text: Used on a pair of XXL spikes for my hiking shoes to climb Quandary Peak this last weekend. A number of highly icy spots, mud, hard pack, and loose powder throughout the hike and these performed really well in all conditions without any comfort issues. Would recommend, especially at the price point.
customer_reviews.author: Marc B

customer_reviews.title: Kept me safe on strenuous hike
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome! I took them on a 9 mile hike up a snowy and icy mountain. These kept me safe going very steeply downhill. They stayed on my shoe no matter what I stepped in, including almost 2 mi of a vertical boulder field. I feel very safe wearing these and highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great for ice fishing
customer_reviews.text: Works great walking on ice. I purchased xl size and it fits my 400 gram insulated rubber boots size 9. Hope that helps
customer_reviews.author: Hlee

customer_reviews.title: Beware!  Way too small even though I ordered a size larger than I needed.
customer_reviews.text: So I ordered a size large. I am usually a women's size 8 and the large is supposed to fit regular hiking boots sizes 9-11. I expected these to be a little loose actually. Instead I could not get them on my boots. The rubber was so stiff I could not stretch them enough to pull on. I tried with boots off and with boots on. I tried for about 10 minutes. I am not weak but I am not Hercules. I ended up returning these unworn. I can't say anything about their function or durability because I never really used them. I am going back to my old beat up Katoulas for now.
customer_reviews.author: kolo:wisi

customer_reviews.title: Excellent traction for nonurban environments
customer_reviews.text: Walk my dog on forested trails every day and without these traction aids could have a slip and fall injury. With them i walk across snow covered frozen ponds and streams without a worry. work great !
customer_reviews.author: Zuri Bahena

customer_reviews.title: Horrible. Junk product, broke first day.
customer_reviews.text: I wore these one day ice fishing, I am a size 10 and was wearing them on my redwing work boots. After about an hour of fishing and walking around, one of the cleats fell off, they don't just fall off.. the main piece of rubber broke and made them unable to go bank on, so I figured I would manage to go with just 1 the rest of the day, well 10 minutes later a different piece of rubber broke on the eyelets where the cleat attached to the rubber mount. So I'm very unsatisfied with these, the rubber material is junk, there is no way they just break, I was walking on flat ice.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Rolando

customer_reviews.title: Excellent piece of gear!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best cleats that we have purchased!! They will fit over any pair of winter boots that we own, our muck boots, and every day regular work boots which makes them perfect for us up here in Alaska. We have multiple pairs of these on different pairs of boots from lace ups to slip ons for different conditions and uses. The rubber is tough and thick but elastic enough to work perfectly. Designed extremely well, excellent quality, rugged, sturdy, heavy duty construction. Very tough spikes for extreme icing conditions. Highly recommend these if you need serious spikes that work, will not come off, and will last.
customer_reviews.author: J. Underwood

customer_reviews.title: Rubber too weak around eyelets
customer_reviews.text: Eyelets tore up while I was high up on an icy slope. This product is dangerous for folks who hike, maybe it is OK around town or in backyard, but not for the trails.
customer_reviews.author: Ahmad M.

customer_reviews.title: One of the best
customer_reviews.text: Fit as described on my hiking shoes. Robust material with welded chain make it super useful.
customer_reviews.author: Vy

customer_reviews.title: So strong
customer_reviews.text: Used these for a full season and was really satisfied with the results. Great for snowpack and ice.
customer_reviews.author: zamberfan

customer_reviews.title: Great safety item
customer_reviews.text: I work in and around a maple sugar operation, and when springtime rains come, everything turns to ice. I had used 'other' ice grippers, and was always disappointed with the quality and longevity. If they worked it was just barely and they were so cheap, they constantly broke, wore out, and had to be replaced. Then I found these Uelfbaby 19 Spikes Crampons. Wow! What a difference and upgrade! These Uelfbaby 19 Spikes Crampons truly are remarkable. I no longer worry about walking on ice. And surprisingly they did not interfere with driving either my car or the sap truck
customer_reviews.author: HiPowerShooter

customer_reviews.title: Purchased in February, 2018.  One Rubber Connector on the Back Finally Broke Today.
customer_reviews.text: These trail microspikes are great, maybe as durable as the more expensive Kahtoola brand. AND one of the rubber connectors that holds the chain loop on the back finally broke today (October 11, 2018). These were used twice a week during the winter when the snow wasn't snowshoe depth. Not sure what to do now. Re-order or switch to a different brand. From one of the reviews regarding the Kahtoola brand, they have been "redesigned" so they are not as durable, trying to "save money" on the construction and thickness of the rubber-chain connectors.
customer_reviews.author: April M. Love

customer_reviews.title: Great traction, need the right boots
customer_reviews.text: Have used these for several 2 hour walks on hilly trails, traction is great. When I used them with a soft top shoe - Lowa Klondike, there was too much pressure on my forefoot. But with my Asolo leather boots, I do not feel the pressure. Also works well with Merrell Moab Vent. I have size men's 9.5 hiking boots, and I got the size Large spikes. I find that it takes quite a bit of pulling strength to get them on, but they stay on very well. I have never used the extra straps, no need.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME, but defective rubber
customer_reviews.text: Worked AWESOME, but then the rubber broke after 2 weeks of use. Too bad because prior to having them i fell several time and had to have knee surgery as a result.
customer_reviews.author: WiiMom

customer_reviews.title: Broken after one use...
customer_reviews.text: Good traction, nice fit, but the chains on my left foot broke after one use (1.2mile hike in a snowy forest). Had to throw them away.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Works great on ice - at least for short trips around the house
customer_reviews.text: I can't rate these for long hikes or anything, but I got a pair for over my street shoes for going out on glare ice around my driveway and the yard where the gutter drains. This year was particularly bad with lots of ice rather than snow initially - and when the spring melt began. After almost falling with just my tennis shoes, I put these ice grips on them and could walk on glare ice without sliding at all. A family member living nearby wasn't as lucky - she talked me into buying them but didn't put them on that day and broke her wrist after falling. How could I not be satisfied with this investment!
customer_reviews.author: visionary

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect
customer_reviews.text: Worked great on an early winter Colorado 14'er hike. Handled six miles of snow, ice, dirt, and rock without any issues. I don't see any reason to spend $70 at REI when these are $25. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Chase

customer_reviews.title: Great spikes at this price point
customer_reviews.text: This little thing saved me several times on the recent road trip. I used it on the hiking trail (half ice/half volcanic rock), frozen lake and even the glacier. Chins and links do get tangled easily so if you are out and about in cold bad weather it could get little challenging to put them on. With that said this is most definitely not pro rated gear and I don't think that it would survive some serious abuse.
customer_reviews.author: Hopopotamus

customer_reviews.title: Just hiked the Grand Canyon in the Snow
customer_reviews.text: We just did a backpacking trip into the Grand Canyon. The Bright Angel trail was snow packed and icy for a least the first 3 Miles. The trail was very slick and was not recommended to be hiked without traction devices. My kids and I used these crampons down and back up and felt very safe and secure, and they held up very well with no issues. I looked at the name brand crampons they sell at the Grand Canyon for $70 and from what I can tell these were of very similar quality but for less than 1/3 of the cost. We're very happy with our crampons!
customer_reviews.author: The Travel Bags

customer_reviews.title: Great microspikes!
customer_reviews.text: Used these to hike in Colorado in the spring and really enjoyed how well they worked. The spikes were sharp and long enough to obtain great traction on both compacted snow and icy trails. They were much better than our hiking partner's yaktraxs or the rentals they got as they could barely stay on the trail with the yaktraxs. Also, they were fairly easy to take on and off and fit well on my boots (Merrell Moab 2 GTX). I would highly recommend these microspikes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Durable and Functional
customer_reviews.text: I loved these crampons. I used them in Colorado for my climb to Mount Meeker. When we started on the trail there was about 2 feet of snow in some places. We started early in the morning when the snow was still fairly packed and the crampons held up well. They obviously do not do well when the snow becomes less packed and slushy or if you are making your way down an incline. My only only complaint was that at time my metal spikes would start to shift to the side of my foot causing me to stop and readjust. Other than that, these crampons were great.
customer_reviews.author: Connor Prewit

customer_reviews.title: Good durability for the price.
customer_reviews.text: 100% as described. My son and I climbed the OS route on the Grand Teton. We used them on the approach and descent. They preformed well without excessive wear and tear. Buy with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Marlon Bateman

customer_reviews.title: Helped us cramp-on up to the top of Angels Landing in Zion
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome. Used them to bike Zion National Park in mid February when they had an unusual snowfall at the base of the canyon. All of the trails we did were covered in snow and ice, including hiking all the way up to the very top of Angels Landing (including the chains). These helped both my wife and I both have sure footing for three long days of hiking without even a slip. They still look brand new and we’re easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Rob in Florida

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed after four hikes
customer_reviews.text: So I am a long time Kahtoola mini spike user, but the cost just keeps going up. I decided to try these and am so far very impressed. I've done four multi mile hikes in Alaska over mud, snow, ice and rock, so far holding up very well. I like the extra strap to keep them in place and prevent loss if they slip off (hasn't happened yet, but will just like the Kahoola's do).
customer_reviews.author: bluelinerak

customer_reviews.title: Good Job!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly I think you guys are doing an awesome job and I wouldn't change anything. This is the second set of micro spikes that I am purchasing from you. My first pair, which I purchased several years ago, is still serving me very well. Thank you for creating a durable product and selling it at an affordable price. You are making people happy. The big company that sells $60 microspikes is dishonest and does not deserve our money. Maybe they will learn a lesson from you.
customer_reviews.author: DERRICK SENN

customer_reviews.title: The chains come apart frequently.
customer_reviews.text: They help on ice and hard backed snow quite a bit. However, the chains come apart frequently. I have had to use pliers to repair the loosely coupled links many times.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Needs metal sleeve to reinforce rubber grommets.
customer_reviews.text: Both pairs I ordered broke on the first hike. The chain links broke through the rubber grommets in the heel portion. I ended up having to slide down the mountain on my snow pants. Other Boy Scouts we were hiking with had spikes with metal sleeves inside the rubber grommets. They all made it down the mountain fine.
customer_reviews.author: Steve T

customer_reviews.title: 15 miles in Iceland no issues!
customer_reviews.text: These performed wonderfully on my trip to iceland. I did a fifteen mile loop Skaftafell hike S3-S6. I was really happy with them. My pair of katollas lasted me a long time, but i wanted to save some money this time, and these were great! i live near the white mountains of NH, and I will see how they hold up in our variable conditions. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: tmbirdsall

customer_reviews.title: They were easy to put on and take off and fairly self ...
customer_reviews.text: I have only worn them 2x but so far they performed as expected. I am a womens 8 1/2 and I believe I ordered the medium and they fit perfectly. They were easy to put on and take off and fairly self explanatory. For the price they performed wonderfully. I wish they had come in a bag (like ski goggles bags) but I can put them in a ziplock. I would recommmed.
customer_reviews.author: Helen s

customer_reviews.title: Felt safe walking
customer_reviews.text: These are a pair of very strong solid crampons. They were my daily drivers during a winter trip , they give you so much grip they make walking on ice a very satisfying and safe experience. I was literally laughing my a#s off at the tourists that ventured going to the icy hikes without crampons, constantly slipping and falling.. HAHA NOT ME! I got my crampons on!
customer_reviews.author: HARSH PATEL

customer_reviews.title: not  good on steep hills
customer_reviews.text: i have 2 pairs, well, 0ne now..used for ice fishing , works fantastic!! i had 7 knee surgerys, and i cant slip, these took all the worry out of walking on ice..used the other pair on steep hill trying to get down to the creek, and right and left tore apart..that was my fault ive bought others, these are the best..they stay put!!
customer_reviews.author: BRUCE D.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value thus far
customer_reviews.text: These spikes seem to be of reasonably high quality. My wife and I have hiked with them over packed snow, ice, and rocky conditions for a few hikes totaling approximately 20 miles. The spikes hold well undert hese conditions and and they've been very durable so far. We're very satisified -- especially given the low price compared with other products.
customer_reviews.author: GeekDaddy

customer_reviews.title: I loved your spike design so much.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a set of black cleats not too long ago for work (I'm in construction and when it's snowy it can get dangerous). I absolutely love them compared to my co-worker's cleats. I will order a pink pair for my girlfriend since I loved your spike design so much. Keep up the great work!
customer_reviews.author: Jan Buskop

customer_reviews.title: Mt Whitney in the snow
customer_reviews.text: Did Mt Whitney in these twice. Was also wearing salmon x alpine varbon boot. When I got to the top of the chute a guy hiking the mountaineering route had the same boots. They have more points than the other brands and are just as cheap
customer_reviews.author: consumer+

customer_reviews.title: Eulfbaby microspikes work well
customer_reviews.text: Competitive price compared to others and they perform well. I didn’t see a good reason to use the straps that came with them, but they might help keep them centered on boots. They tended to slip somewhat on steep ice and snow.
customer_reviews.author: Sofaman

customer_reviews.title: Walking has never been so easy in winter
customer_reviews.text: I live in Minnesota and it’s a pain in the butt to walk on ice in the winter! I can deal with snow but I don’t like when the snow melts during the day and freezes at night. It’s the worst. Wearing these ice grips makes it sooo easy to walk on ice! No more falling on sidewalks!
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely great...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these in order to walk my dog on the icy roads of Wyoming. With these cleats I can now walk securely without the risk of falling and possibly dropping my dogs's leash and him running off. They are very easy to put on and I do clean them with water after each use and sometimes wipe them down with some oil to prevent rusting (which they have not!). Would be a great present for elderly parents who still go on occasional walks or simply for anyone needing a secure grip while being outdoors in the winter. I highly recommend these cleats!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dymphie S.

customer_reviews.title: nice crampons
customer_reviews.text: I used them on ice and snow on a daily basis They're easy to put on if you get the one that's right for your shoe. They're a bit stiff the first time you put them on but the rubber gets more flexible over time while keeping the size and grip. And they are still good for another winter.
customer_reviews.author: Raquel Harris Fernández

customer_reviews.title: Sizing way off
customer_reviews.text: Sizing way off. I didn’t find this out until it was too late to return them. I bought a size over my boot size and they will not stretch enough to put them on without dislocating your shoulder !!!
customer_reviews.author: Bear

customer_reviews.title: Wish they would have fit as they are much better than a previous pair I had that the staps ...
customer_reviews.text: These are exceptionally well made. My son has a pair, wears them ice fishing and they are holding up very well. I ordered a pair, but just too small for my Muck boots, size 13's. Wish they would have fit as they are much better than a previous pair I had that the staps broke first day out. I would recommend these based on my son's use and my observations.
customer_reviews.author: WR Boy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent gripping qualities
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for ice fishing on a clear frozen lake. Great grip. Easy and comfortable to walk with these on. A bit of work to get them on my size 14 LaCrosse boots but worth the tug. If they ever wear out I would definitely buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy V

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware! Stitching on straps missing, buckles drop off
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because other cleats/spikes get pulled off in the thick snow & ice of Barrow Alaska. I bought these because they seemed to wrap tightly around boots and the strap would prevent them being pulled off. When I pulled them out of the box, the buckle from one strap dropped to the floor - it hadn't been stitched. I contacted the manufacturer, who bragged about customer service on the package, and received no response. All I wanted was a replacement strap, but all they want is to make money.
customer_reviews.author: Sue Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Shoe Spikes to walk on ice
customer_reviews.text: I like them and they work well, but unless there is more ice than we had, I sink into the asphalt pavement. Also they are longer than expected. DO NOT WEAR when you enter from outside. They fit well and do what they are expected to do.
customer_reviews.author: Red Devil

customer_reviews.title: these really work well
customer_reviews.text: I live in a remote area where the driveway and road both are covered with ice during certain parts of the winter. I can walk comfortably even down some pretty sloped terrain. No more slipping on the ice with these.
customer_reviews.author: K. Picha

customer_reviews.title: Incredible value and great traction
customer_reviews.text: These things are awesome. I thought for the price I paid, they'd be cheap and I wouldn't be too happy. I was wrong. I've worn them a half-dozen times ice fishing on glare ice and have not once felt off balance or like these weren't giving me max traction. Something to keep in mind, these will clog easily and become an unstable platform via ice buildup in slushy ice conditions with sub-freezing air temps. In otherwords, if preceding days temps create slush and slush layer does not refreeze fully, it will accumulate on the cleats and turn icy if air is subfreezing. Tap them with the ice scoop and away you go.
customer_reviews.author: Capt. Snowflake

customer_reviews.title: Durable and reliable!
customer_reviews.text: They've lasted a lot longer than I expected. I've worn these on 4-5 hikes so far and they've worked great! For those who report these breaking earlier, I've only worn these on snow or pure ice and take them off as soon as the trail becomes somewhat rocky.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Ramos

customer_reviews.title: value for money!
customer_reviews.text: Overall, value for money! I got this when I was hiking in the Rocky Mountains in early July. It's very easy to wear for my hiking boots and certainly helped with traction!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Cahill

customer_reviews.title: steady in snow
customer_reviews.text: These are easier to get over shoes quickly than previous crampons I have owned and the spikes are sharper/deeper than I have experienced as well. I've been on ~10 hikes in the snow with them and so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: KCassey

customer_reviews.title: Great grip!
customer_reviews.text: I received these today and wore them to walk the huskies on the icy sidewalks in Minneapolis. I was quite impressed with the grip. Granted it was a balmy 17 degrees and the ice was fairly soft, but I felt very stable on the walk. Winner!
customer_reviews.author: Mary B

customer_reviews.title: Broke in 1 week
customer_reviews.text: I was initially very pleased with these. They appeared to be a great product for a great price. I bought them for ice fishing and they provided great traction on the ice. Tonight I noticed that one of the straps has already broke. I don't know how long before these are unusable. I guess sometimes you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch

customer_reviews.title: Good on ice or snow
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put on my boots and they wasn't uncomfortable at all to walk in. I felt confident walking on both the thick snow and ice. Lightweight but durable.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Speaker

customer_reviews.title: Great grip
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for winter hikes especially when it is icy. So far this winter I've only needed them twice, but they work well. These micro spikes worked perfectly on a mountain trail covered in ice and packed snow! They dug right into the ice and I didn't have any problem going up or down hill . I'm very happy with them. I hope they last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: David Wayne

customer_reviews.title: They said they were so glad they had these as many other hikers were slipping ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my son and brother to hike Franklin Falls last January due to heavy snow and ice. They said they were so glad they had these as many other hikers were slipping and falling since they didn't have proper foot attire! Fit perfectly and held up as expected.
customer_reviews.author: GChapman

customer_reviews.title: Worked great but wore out quickly.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for about 3 months, just long enough to get through ice season. Failed to stay sharpe after that. Would be better if they were hardened steel.
customer_reviews.author: m. parkman

customer_reviews.title: they were so perfect
customer_reviews.text: My two previous orders were indeed Uelfbaby's. And they were so perfect. I can appreciate your challenges trying to make the product better and keeping all customers happy. you've improved them from a safety perspective, thank you for your nice product and service
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Received a used item
customer_reviews.text: Item was sent used... there was dirt on them. The other one I bought for my boyfriend was new. Unfortunately, since it was a last minute purchase for a trip.. I will have to just use the item. But this was not something I anticipated since it is being sold as ‘new’. Please beware.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Won’t let you down!
customer_reviews.text: Super great for all terrain. I’ve used for climbing and standing on steep banks. You can feel and hear the bite they make with each step. Highly recommend. Can’t go wrong with the these especially with the price.
customer_reviews.author: JaynesFamilyFarm

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat the price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these thinking they might work ok. They are amazing!! They stretch over practically any shoe or boot and keep me upright on the ice and on hikes. Bought another set for a friend too!
customer_reviews.author: mucleo sartor

customer_reviews.title: For the price, I was impressed that they lasted as long as they did.
customer_reviews.text: I stretched these out around a men's 13 Muck Boot (probably asking a bit much), they worked great for a few months of surveying in Vermont. Ultimately, one of the chain links couldn't handle the stress and opened up, releasing the rubber... for the price, I was impressed that they lasted as long as they did.
customer_reviews.author: mbackman66

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and light!
customer_reviews.text: Love this spikes. I am literally afraid to walk on ice much more falling on ice. I wore this spikes to see for myself if I can walk on ice with confidence and I did. It was so comfy and so light.
customer_reviews.author: Scott G.

customer_reviews.title: Performs-
customer_reviews.text: Very solid crampons that stay in place even when wet snow builds into ice balls on the bottom. Hiked up a mountain in the Adirondacks with them ...6 miles round trip and they stayed in place and really gripped at the top, particularly on the descent. Lightweight to carry along in the pack in case you need snowshoes for part of the trip. Fantastic product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Very Grippy, Potential Life Savers
customer_reviews.text: These things are perfect for winter hiking in Utah. They are light enough that I carry them in the bag on my pack belt so and easy to slip on and off when it gets slick to when the trail clears again.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Good product great value
customer_reviews.text: After busting my butt A couple of times paint balling during the winter I decided to buy these they were worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Works well for hiking
customer_reviews.text: This is my first crampons. They are very fit and not easy to put on. I am very happy to see how easy these hiking trips are. My first hike for more than 2 hours, my feet feel stable and safe throughout the time. I am hiking on ice, snow and gravel, and the altitude changes moderately. The studs are sturdy and lightweight, so they fit easily into my backpack for carrying when you need them.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Thuema

customer_reviews.title: Love Them!
customer_reviews.text: I tried these out as soon as i got them. These crampons are the best! No slipping on total ice! Best part is they don't fall off my boots at all! Love them! Would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: David F.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for hiking on ice and snow!
customer_reviews.text: I love these miscrospikes! I used them in snow and ice and they worked perfectly. The teeth held up really well and I didn't fall once. I walked on packed snow, jagged ice, and even hiked down and uphill. I've already recommended these to my boyfriend.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Allen

customer_reviews.title: Walk with safety on Icy Streets
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put on and take off, perfect for winter on hard snow or ice, reliable and static, adjustability makes them a good choice for nearly every type of footwear, excellent value for money.
customer_reviews.author: xiaoling wang

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Fitment is a little tight which you feel it is very secure but it might interfere a little with your walking. After several hours of walking in snow/ice I sometimes notice they would have gone sideways.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro Burgas

customer_reviews.title: Size LARGE fits women’s size 6 Sorrel boots!!!
customer_reviews.text: Finally found a good fit for on my Sorrel boots!! I wear size 6 shoes and the “ Large” Uelfbaby fits fine. I found its easiest to put onto the boot when it’s already on my foot.
customer_reviews.author: JulieG

customer_reviews.title: Good Cleats
customer_reviews.text: Took these to Iceland in December. Did a long hike to swim in hot springs. And also got to see an ancient valley the next day. These things made walking on all the snow and ice so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good value
customer_reviews.text: I use these to continue running in the winter time and haven't even come closeto falling yet.
customer_reviews.author: Z. Donaldson

customer_reviews.title: Ice Fishing Cleats
customer_reviews.text: bought for my wife as some ice fishing cleats. I own the same style as well and work very well on the ice all winter.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas W

customer_reviews.title: perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality.I wear a size 10 hiking shoe, and the X-large size fit them perfectly. However they were stretched a bit more than I liked on my bulky hiking boots. I was afraid the steal rig would pull thru the rubber. But they didn't.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria Meadows

customer_reviews.title: All day traction solution!
customer_reviews.text: This is suitable for everyone and fits on different kinds of shoes.Easy to wear ,lightweight and has heavy duty spikes.
customer_reviews.author: Peter U

customer_reviews.title: I'm not sure
customer_reviews.text: Don't do well on ice, but good with snow. Does fall apart after extended use.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Abel

customer_reviews.title: Great for surfcasting! No kidding...
customer_reviews.text: I actually use them more for surfcasting. They are perfect for walking on green, slippery, slimy, seaweed covered rocks and jetties. WAY cheaper than Korkers and double as ice grips as well!
customer_reviews.author: G. Routenberg

customer_reviews.title: Great for Ice Fishing
customer_reviews.text: Great for getting out on the lake ice for fishing. I used them several times this year when we had ice here in central Ohio. They are a little tough to get on initially, but after a couple of usages, they go on easier.
customer_reviews.author: Cachafich-Infinity

customer_reviews.title: This crampon helped me a lot
customer_reviews.text: I bought them to work on the canyon slope behind our house, which is at least 45 degrees steep and drops 25 feet. The soil is usually dry, unstable and difficult to move. This cra
customer_reviews.author: Madison O.

customer_reviews.title: WORK AS ADVERTISED
customer_reviews.text: I took these out on some short climbs locally over steep rocky terrain and large sections of bald granite slopes, covered in ice and these were great! They did precisely what I bought them for and I'm looking forward to taking them out once winter returns - lol - might be a while now!
customer_reviews.author: ChuckCarter

customer_reviews.title: SAFETY achieved!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! After several family members took tumbles on the slick ice this winter, this product kept them SAFE! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: PoisonAero

customer_reviews.title: I fell all the time on ice - but these ...
customer_reviews.text: I fell all the time on ice - but these puppies dig right in - probably saved me a fx!
customer_reviews.author: Gwenski

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: These were a terrific purchase - I LOVE THEM!!! They go on and come off very easily on my size 10 boots. I feel very secure walking on snow and ice on hilly/wooded terrain. I also wear them shoveling or any time I know I'm going to be stepping on icy surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: C. Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: I have another pair of these that works just fine, so I’m not sure why this second pair ...
customer_reviews.text: These fell apart after one use. One of the links on the side that secured the spikes to the rubber slip was pulled open after a few steps. I have another pair of these that works just fine, so I’m not sure why this second pair is so fragile.
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: Durable!!
customer_reviews.text: These microspikes are amazing! I do a ton of off trail waterfall hunting. So these see a lot of rocks and creek beds and wet logs. Have held up amazingly. I am now buying my second pair as my first ones finally broke after 50+ hikes and a serious beating. Highly recommend these over buying the more expensive options like Kahtoola.
customer_reviews.author: Kellen

customer_reviews.title: Must have for winter
customer_reviews.text: I have a steep driveway that likes to ice up over the winter. With these on it's like walking on dry concrete.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: sturdy and durable
customer_reviews.text: These are easy to put on, appear sturdy and durable. so happy I chose these, perfect for icy trail walking, worth the money spent.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Daugherty

customer_reviews.title: good quality
customer_reviews.text: Now the purchase is very affordable, try on, very suitable, Very good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Delia Mejia

customer_reviews.title: Got ice? Get these.
customer_reviews.text: I felt like they might rip if I stretched them too far. I'm size 9.5 US. They didn't tho so that's good. While wearing them they where awesome. No fear of slipping on the ice.
customer_reviews.author: Lance Jones

customer_reviews.title: These spikes look good, provide the required traction and are easy to put on and take off
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put on stay in place and provide the traction necessary to walk trails in the winter and spring
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: No more slipping and sliding
customer_reviews.text: I loved these were my salvation in the snow I was always falling slipping now I feel secure would recommend
customer_reviews.author: sandiadulce123

customer_reviews.title: Excellent! I can walk easily on smooth ice.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing - I can walk on slick ice with no problem. They're a bit challenging to put on boots and you certainly can't drive or walk inside (except on mats) with them, so I'm just keeping them on one pair of boots. I feel much safer and I can go outside now on the iciest days -- important for exercise and mental well being in the winter!
customer_reviews.author: Raul Flores

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great fit and I'm definitely going to have a more stable grip on my hikes
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Giovanetty

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Broke 5 miles into my first hike. I don’t recommend.
customer_reviews.author: AnnH

customer_reviews.title: Size
customer_reviews.text: Bought xl but way too small for size 11.5 boots
customer_reviews.author: Run Stone

customer_reviews.title: Works but heavy
customer_reviews.text: They have huge teeth and really dig but seem very small for my shoe size and really heavy
customer_reviews.author: SamCorgi

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Used these on a 5 mile trek up and down a mountain this winter, held up well to 4200' with significant snow and ice.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Handel

customer_reviews.title: Fitment is good!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for ice fishing. They fit my boots nicely. Very easy to install. Size 12 boots so I went with the XXL.
customer_reviews.author: B. Durrence

product_meta.title: Uelfbaby Upgraded 19 Spikes Crampons Ice Snow Grips Traction Cleats System Safe Protect for Walking, Jogging, or Hiking on Snow and Ice (Fit S/M/L/XL/XXL Shoes/Boots)
feature_bullets: MULTIPLE USES: Suitable Not Only For Outdoor Ice And Snow, But Also For The City To Use During The Snowy Weather, Particularly Suitable For The Elder and Kids. Reduce The Risk Of Jnjury From Slips And Falls When Walk On Ice, Snow, Mud And Wet Grass Or Other Poor Conditions.

STRONGER SPIKES:19 stainless steel spikes can dig into varieties terrain,the steel chain can prevent move side-to-side, keep you safe and injury-free.Excellent toughness and strength,will not bend, fixed performance and climbing performance is excellent

FIRM CONNECTION:High-strength steel spike-and-chain system provides excellent traction on a variety of icy surfaces, durable elastic harness ensures a tight hold on your shoe, even at cold temperatures.Ergonomic plate system for added spike stability.

DURABLE MATERIAL:Aggressive traction, professional equipment, great toughness and 5mm thicker than ordinary rubber,TPE rubber is highly elastic and won't tear or snap. Improved design increases the durability and added -40℉ cold-resistant

ORDER NOW WITH 100% MONEY BACK & SATISFACTION GUARANTEE - If you are not completely satisfied with our Micro spikes within the first year, we will replace it with a new one or refund your money, no questions asked, Our Customers Matter! We have upgraded to 5 sizes to match your shoes more accurately and make you more stable in walking. please refer to the size chart in the picture. If you have any questions, please feel free to email us directly.
